activities: This filing is in regards to Ariba’s web-based service known as the Ariba Supplier Network and the Ariba OnDemand Services, including associated customer support services, hosted in the United States but accessed internationally (including transfers to these Ariba solutions from the Quadrem Network, hosted in the EU and operated by an Ariba subsidiary).  The main purpose of the Ariba Supplier Network and Ariba OnDemand Services is to electronically connect buying and supplying organizations to enable them to exchange business documents for sourcing decisions and procurement transactions and to store procurement related data for the buying organization.  This involves management of the Ariba Supplier Network business to business technology platform, and maintenance of the Buyer’s and Supplier’s accounts on the platform.  Valid contact information is required to facilitate the transactions between the business entities and for user accounts. The personal information entered into this system is primarily business contact information of representatives of companies using the Ariba Supplier Network and Ariba OnDemand Services and may include personal data transferred from the Quadrem Network solution, hosted in the EU, to the Ariba solutions hosted in the United States. As of September 2006, the users of the Ariba Supplier Network, Ariba OnDemand Services, and related services represent approximately 140,000 organizations (includes both supplier and buyers).
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
privacyprograms: WebTrust (Security, Availability, Confidentiality, Processing Integrity), TRUSTe
recoursemech: Dispute Resolution: For questions or concerns regarding privacy statements and the Ariba Supplier Network, the first point of contact is to write to privacy@arib.com.  For any unresolved complaints or if a complaint is not satisfactorily addressed, the organization will utilize the European Data Protection Authorities (EU DPAs) and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) as its dispute resolution mechanism.
